reasoning: Developmental and epileptic encephalopathy type 16 (DEE-16) is a specific genetic subtype caused by TBC1D24 mutations. Overall EIEE incidence is 3.6-10 per 100,000 births. DEE-16 represents a small fraction of the ~169 per 100,000 cumulative DEE incidence in children. Estimated incidence ~0.2 per 100,000 based on it being one of many genetic subtypes. Limited data available for this specific subtype.
source: Orphanet Early Infantile DEE registry, epidemiological studies on DEE
